intro: Gonatocarpus, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is typically found in coastal areas and brackish water environments, adapting well to saline conditions. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Gonatocarpus plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
